page.title: 14Kington :Road Transport
page.content: Kington has no rail transport but it is well served by buses. The companies running buses through Kington are Sargeants (based on Kington), Primrose and Canyon. These buses bring people from the surrounding countryside into Kington and take people to Hereford, Leominster, Llandrindod and Hay. Kington has great traffic problems. It has very narrow streets where vans and lorries stop to load and unload at shops. In the morning esp when the school buses are going through Kington traffic can come to a standstill when buses and lorries meet. Buses often have to go onto the pavement and lorries have to park close to shop windows. There have been several minor accidents. In 1982 a by-pass was opened to take heavy vehicles round the town, esp those from the two quarries just west of Kington.
